city_name: SUMMIT One Vanderbilt Tickets
description: With this ticket to the Summit One Vanderbilt, you’ll see futuristic digital shows inside one of New York’s newest skyscrapers. You’ll also take in views of Manhattan from a height of 370 metres.  As you explore three levels of multi-sensory galleries inside the skyscraper, you’ll see digital art installations by internationally acclaimed artists and designers. You’ll see works inspired by stories, optical illusions and interactivity. You’ll also see the busy streets below the building during the ‘Levitation’ experience, which involves standing on a transparent platform over 300 metres above the ground.  When you reach the SUMMIT Terrace, you can see New York’s skyline and views for up to 80 miles. You can also order cocktails and light fare from Café Après.
why_visit: ['Three floors of multi-sensory immersive experiences at the top of a skyscraper', 'Panoramic views of New York and landmarks like the Empire State Building', 'Futuristic observation deck that combines elements of art and technology']
whats_included: ['Admission', 'Levitation experience']
additional_info: ['Children aged 0–5 years can join for free.\rPlease note that some rooms and installations have mirrored floors. Please dress comfortably and in accordance with the tour. Trousers, shorts or tights are recommended. Sunglasses are recommended for day visits. Note that stiletto heels, steel-toe boots and any footwear that could cause damage to the mirrored floors are not allowed on this tour.\rPlease note that there is no storage for personal items. Large bags, large backpacks and luggage are not permitted on this tour.\rProfessional photographs are available to purchase in print and digital format at the end of the experience.\rPlease bring your ticket with you to the attraction.\rShow more', 'Show more']
location: SUMMIT One Vanderbilt Tickets45 East 42nd Street, New York, NYPlease arrive at Summit One Vanderbilt. The entrance is located on the Main Concourse of Grand Central Terminal.

You will also have the opportunity to see the last visible remains of the Vesey Street staircase, known as the 'Survivors' Staircase'.  Additionally, you will be able to visit the Memorial Plaza pools, which were built where the World Trade Center once stood.

city_name: One-hour Sightseeing Yacht Cruise
description: On this one-hour, guided sightseeing cruise, you’ll get to view popular New York landmarks with live commentary on board. You’ll go on board the Majestic Princess yacht, where you can relax on the spacious outdoor decks, or take in views of the New York skyline from the windows, indoors.  As you cruise along the East River, you can listen to live commentary about New York’s attractions. You’ll also get a chance to take a photograph with the Statue of Liberty, from a distance of 100 feet. Additionally, you’ll get to view the Freedom Tower, Brooklyn Bridge, Manhattan Bridge, Governors Island, Battery Park, and Ellis Island.

city_name: Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum
description: With this ticket, you’ll have the chance to explore the history of iconic vehicles at the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum.  You’ll discover the history of the USS Intrepid aircraft carrier, along with learning more about the space shuttle Enterprise with a visit to the Space Shuttle Pavilion. You’ll also be able to explore the Growler guided-missile submarine and spend time hearing the stories and first-hand accounts of people involved in the history of each vehicle.  You’ll have the opportunity to watch a film dedicated to the Intrepid, along with a film telling the story of the Kamikaze pilots, before having the chance to end your visit with a tour of a Concorde jet.

city_name: Central Park Zoo Admission Ticket
description: This ticket will grant you admission to the Central Park Zoo and its many attractions therein, such as the Tisch Children’s Zoo and a 4D theatre.  Upon admission, you’ll have the chance to explore the zoo’s many exhibits, which are split into three major biomes: the Tropic Zone, Temperate Territory and the Polar Circle. During your time in each of these areas, you’ll get the opportunity to admire animals such as snow leopards, grizzly bears, a colony of penguins from Antarctica and many others.  Additionally, you’ll gain entry to the Tisch Children’s Zoo, which offers interactions with goat sheep, ducks and cows. description: On this full-day tour, you’ll travel from New York to Washington DC to see some of the USA’s most famous landmarks. The scenic route will take you through the states of New Jersey, Delaware and Maryland before arriving in the capital. You’ll make a stop at Arlington National Cemetery to visit JFK’s grave before heading to several sites of governance. You’ll visit the exteriors of the White House, Capitol building and the Senate and see the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum.  Your itinerary will also include photo stops at the Lincoln, Washington, Vietnam and Korean Memorials and a panoramic drive before returning to New York.

city_name: Museum of Modern Art Ticket
description: This ticket will grant you access to one of New York's most recognisable names – MOMA, or the Museum of Modern Art. Inside the sprawling institution, you'll find a vast collection of contemporary art with masterpieces like Van Gogh's The Starry Night and Warhol's Gold Marilyn Monroe.  You can also view works by artists like Jackson Pollock, Jasper Johns, Cindy Sherman and Elizabeth Murray. Your ticket will include a complimentary audio guide on your device as well as access to special exhibitions, films and gallery talks.

city_name: Brooklyn Nets Basketball Game Ticket at Barclays Center
description: Seeing the Brooklyn Nets play a basketball game at Barclays Center is an experience like no other. Enjoy assigned seating with your game ticket and be there live to see the thrilling action on the court as the biggest stars in the NBA put on a show you'll never forget. Barclays Center, home to the Brooklyn Nets, is renowned for its cutting-edge design and the distinctive oculus that illuminates the arena's exterior with vibrant LED displays. The venue's location in the heart of Brooklyn adds to its significance, making it not only at the epicentre of New York basketball culture, but also within close reach of bars and restaurants for pre and post game dining and nightlife. With a wide range of concessions, facilities and matchday entertainment on hand, whether you're a solo traveller, or attending with friends and loved ones, a trip to the basketball to see the Brooklyn Nets is an experience not to be missed!

As you ride through the park, you can take in the art, architecture and history that it is known for.

You’ll also come face to face with the Statue of Liberty on Ellis Island as well as see several other attractions.

description: This ticket will give you access to the Edge Observation Deck, known as the highest outdoor viewing platform in the western hemisphere. You’ll be able to walk on the glass floor and enjoy the panoramic views of the New York skyline and Manhattan. city_name: 9/11 Tribute Museum and Memorial
description: With these tickets, you can learn more about the fateful day of September 11th, 2001 and its continuing impact. You'll have access to the 9/11 Tribute Museum where you'll find an exhibition exploring the lead up to the terror attacks, how they unfolded on the day and their aftermath. You can view portraits of the 2983 victims and watch film screenings about the events in the museum's auditorium.  You may also be able to attend a free, live talk, offered occasionally to visitors. If you've selected the museum and memorial option, your trip will include a visit to the official memorial. All visitors will also have the option to view the commemorative pools in the footprint of the Twin Towers, open to the public and free of charge.

Know that you are making a difference by simply choosing our tours; we offer guests a way to give back to the community, by engaging with our social impact partners. You’ll go aboard The BEAST, a custom-built, 70-foot speedboat, which can travel at a speed of 72 kph.  After boarding, you’ll experience an adrenaline-fueled ride across New York Harbor, with multiple twists and turns, as the boat cuts through the waves.  En route, you’ll stop to get a close-up view of the Statue of Liberty and to take photos with the attraction. Additionally, you can gain insights into New York from the two captains on board.

city_name: Washington DC and Philadelphia Trip from New York
description: Your action-packed 17-hour day begins at Times Square in Manhattan, where you’ll meet your tour guide for the day. You are then driven four or five hours to Washington DC, the modern-day capital of the United States. You'll visit the Iwo Jima Memorial and the Lincoln Memorial before stopping in front of the White House and Capitol building. You are then given time for lunch and a chance to visit one of the Smithsonian museums. You then get to board the coach again and make your way on a three-hour journey towards Philadelphia, the first capital of the United States. You get to go for a walking tour at the Independence National Historical Park, and you'll see the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall, where America's Declaration of Independence took shape in 1776. Before leaving Philadelphia you get to stop at the Rocky Steps in front of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, where you can mimic Sylvester Stallone running up the steps in the 1976 movie. Then you return in comfort to Times Square in Manhattan, having come face-to-face with a great deal of American history in one day.

You'll even get to walk straight into an Egyptian temple - The Temple of Dendur, which was brought from Egypt and re-made right here in The Met. city_name: Harlem Gospel Service and Walking Tour
description: On this two-part tour, you’ll dive into the history and culture of Harlem with a born-and-bred guide. You’ll begin at the Harlem Heritage Tourism and Cultural Center where you’ll have a light breakfast and video presentation.  Your first stop will be at a historic church where you’ll participate in a one-hour service with prayer and gospel music. After the service, you’ll head off on a two-hour walking tour of the neighbourhood.  You’ll pass a selection of key locations like theatres, churches, jazz clubs, sites from the Civil Rights Movement and beautiful architecture. Along the way, your guide will cover 400 years of history with a focus on the 20th century. In addition to your guide’s stories, you’ll view multimedia like portable video, sound and pictures.

city_name: City of Contrasts Sightseeing Tour
description: On this tour, you’ll travel outside Manhattan and explore New York’s hidden gems. You’ll be able to see the city from a multicultural perspective and gain insights into life in different boroughs. You’ll first head to the Bronx, where you’ll have the chance to see the Yankee Stadium and walk along the colourful streets decorated by murals. You’ll continue to Queens, where you’ll visit the Flushing Meadows Corona Park and discover such attractions as the Unisphere, Citi Field and the National Tennis Center. You’ll be able to delve into Indian culture as you stroll through Little India and stop at the waterfront, overlooking the skyline. After that, you’ll have the opportunity to explore Brooklyn’s Williamsburg and learn about the Hasidic community before having an Italian meal, taking a ferry ride or returning to Manhattan over the Brooklyn Bridge.

You’ll then reach the National Mall and the Lincoln Memorial, where you’ll get the opportunity to learn about the 16th president and his achievements. After that, you’ll discover the White House and the Capitol from outside. You’ll continue to Philadelphia, where you’ll be able to visit the Independence National Historical Park and see such significant landmarks as the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall. Besides, you’ll have the chance to stop at the Philadelphia Museum of Art and capture the famous Rocky Steps.

city_name: Day Trip to Boston with Harvard and Freedom Trail Tour
description: On this day trip from New York, you’ll have the chance to discover some of Boston's main landmarks, including its prestigious universities. The first stop will be in Cambridge, where you’ll get to explore America’s oldest academic institution: you’ll have the opportunity to walk through Harvard Yard, the oldest part of the campus, admire the imposing building hosting Widener Library and its over three million books, and stand in front the bronze statue of John Harvard – and even touch his left foot for good luck. You’ll then move on to a panoramic tour passing by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Cambridge College and the City Hall, before crossing the Charles River and reach Boston city centre. Here, you’ll be able to visit Copley Square and Trinity Church, as well as walk along the Freedom Trail, covering 16 locations of historic relevance, including Boston Common Park. At lunchtime, you’ll get to stroll around Quincy Market and try some local delicacies such as clam chowder or lobster rolls. Finally, you’ll arrive on the site of the famous ‘Tea Party’, a political protest that started the American resistance to the British, for one last visit before heading back to New York.

It is thought that at least 40% of all current US citizens can trace one or more of their ancestors to Ellis Island!Once concluding the fully-guided portion, visit the 9/11 Memorial & Museum and honor all those who lost their lives in the horrific terror attacks on September 11, 2001. city_name: Walking Tour of SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown
description: On this two-hour walking tour, you will explore the neighbourhoods of SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown. You’ll discover the highlights of each district, including historical churches, ornate architecture and even several sites associated with mob activity.  Start your tour in SoHo’s Cast Iron Historic District, where you can admire the neighbourhood’s 19th-century buildings and chic restaurants and boutiques. Next, you’ll head to Little Italy and then round off your tour in nearby Chinatown. Along the way, you’ll learn about each districts’ early immigrants and sample a diverse array of cultural delicacies.

city_name: Manhattan Architecture Yacht Cruise

You’ll step aboard an elegant, 1920s-style yacht and set sail down the Hudson, East and Harlem Rivers, circumnavigating the island of Manhattan.  You’ll view iconic monuments, parks and infrastructure, and of course, the mighty buildings that define the city skyline. You’ll have excellent views of highlights like the Statue of Liberty, the Chrysler Building, Woolworth Building and more. The route will take you under all 18 bridges that connect Manhattan to the outer boroughs, and you’ll listen to engaging commentary from a member of the American Institute of Architects’ NY chapter along the way.

city_name: 9/11 Memorial & Ground Zero Tour with Optional 9/11 Museum Ticket
description: This Ground Zero walking tour begins Battery Park where host will take you past Wall St & the NY Stock exchange as we head towards ground zero. We will visit St Paul's Chapel, known as the “Little Chapel That Stood”know as the oldest public building still actively used in NYC. It was a miracle that this church survived all the falling debris of the World Trade Center located 1 block away. Being so close family of missing loved ones used the fence as a bulletin board to post signs looking for missing family members becoming the heart of the rescue days following the brutal attack. We will visit The Fire Department of New York Memorial wall seeing what the first responders faced & did on this day & fire station located at ground zero. Entering ground zero or the National 9/11 Memorial built in memory of the 2,753 victim of World Trade Center attack as the plane crashed into Tower 1 & 2. Upgrade to 911 National September 11 Museum. Multimedia displays, narratives and artifacts.
whats_included: ['Exclusive Skip the Line Access to the 911 Museum (if option Chosen)', 'Narrated walking tour', 'Guided visit to the Ground Zero & 9/11 Memorial', 'Professional, local guide with personal connection to 9/11']

city_name: New York CityPASS
description: With the New York CityPASS, you'll be able to explore the city's top attractions at discounted rates. You'll receive up to 40% off admission fees at famous landmarks such as the Empire State Building's 86th-floor observatory, the American Museum of Natural History, The Metropolitan Museum of Art and more. The pass gives you the flexibility of discovering the city at your own pace over nine consecutive days.
whats_included: ['Nine-day consecutive attraction pass', 'Two pre-selected attractions and three of your choosing']
whats_not_included: ['Transport', 'Meals and beverages', 'Other personal expenses', 'Crown tickets and pedestal access on Liberty Island']

window 5 at Battery Park; or at either ticket window at Liberty State Park.\rHow to get there: Please take subway line 4 or 5 to Bowling Green Subway Station.\r Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises\r Address: Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises, Pier 83, W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA\rRedemption location: Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises ticket office VIP window\rHow to get there: Please take subway lines A, C, E, 1, 2, 3, 7, S, N, Q or R to Times Sq-42 St station and then walk for around 17 minutes.\r 9/11 Memorial and Museum\r Address: 180 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007\rHow to get there: Please take subway lines N, R or W to Cortlandt St station.\r Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum\r Address: Pier 86, W 46th St & 12th Ave, New York, NY 10036\rHow to get there: Please take subway lines A, C, E, 1, 2, 3, N, Q, R, 7 or S trains and get off at 42nd St. station.Please note that some attractions may require you to stand in the main ticket line to secure a free or discounted child’s ticket. \r Free admission eligibility criteria is as follows:\r- Empire State Building: free for children aged 0–5 (depending on the date of visit) \r- American Museum of Natural History: free for children aged 0–2 years \r- Top of the Rock Observation Deck: free for children aged 0–5 years \r- Ferry access to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island: free for children aged 0–3 years \r- 9/11 Memorial & Museum: free for children aged 0–6 years \r- Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises: free for children aged 0–2 years \r- Intrepid Museum: free for children aged 0–4 years \r- Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum: free for children aged 0–11 years \r Please note that the admission to the Empire State Building includes a general admission to the 86th-floor observatory, second floor museum and a same-night general admission. \r Please note that the admission to the American Museum of Natural History includes access to  permanent Museum Halls and a choice of one special exhibition, film, or the Hayden Planetarium Space Show (depending on availability). \r The pass includes a choice of admission to three of the following activities: \r- Admission to the Top of the Rock Observation Deck \r- General admission ferry access to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, including a return ferry trip, audio guides and admission to the Statue of Liberty Museum and Ellis Island Immigration Museum\r- Admission to the 9/11 Memorial & Museum \r- General admission to Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises. Guggenheim Museum, including special exhibits and a digital guide \r Please note that audio guide availability depends on the venue. Refer to the official website for more information. \r Please note that re-entry is not permitted after leaving the venue. \r Please note that reservations are required at most attractions. \r Please note that advance reservations are necessary at select attractions. \r Please note that the capacity might be limited, so planning ahead is advisable. \r Voucher validity is 365 days from the booking confirmation date, expiring at 23:59 on the last day. Once redeemed, the voucher is valid for nine consecutive days, including the first day of use. \r Specific opening hours for various attractions like the Empire State Building, American Museum of Natural History and Top of the Rock Observation Deck are as follows:\r- Empire State Building: Monday–Sunday: 09:00–00:00 \r- American Museum of Natural History: Monday–Sunday: 10:00–17:30 \r- Top of the Rock Observation Deck: Monday–Sunday: 09:00–11:00 \r Operational hours for some attractions like Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises, 9/11 Memorial and Museum and Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum require referring to the official website for operational hours. \r For the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island ferry, the ticket office operational hours are 07:45–16:30. \r Ferry frequency is every 30–45 minutes. \r Please note that the first departure time is at 09:30.\r Please note that the first departure time on Memorial Day and Columbus Day is at08:30.\r Please note that the hours provided are for reference and might change without prior notice.']

description: This tour will take you into the fictional world of classic HBO show The Sopranos as you explore iconic scenes and filming locations. A sightseeing bus will drive you around New Jersey, stopping off at significant sites. You'll visit the places that appeared as Pizzaland, The Muffler Man, Father Phil's parish and more. You can also visit the inside of the Bada Bing location, sit on the steps where Chris was shot and sit in the exact diner booth as Tony in the series finale.

city_name: Horse-carriage Ride in Central Park
description: With this tour, you will get the opportunity to discover the sights and sounds of Central Park on a horse-drawn carriage ride.  A driver will take you along the 3.5 miles trail, which will go through some iconic landmarks. They will also share informative commentary about the city and the park’s top sights. The ride will stop for a break at the Bethesda Terrace and Fountain, where you will be able to observe the beauty of these two architectural features and the Lake.

city_name: Madison Square Garden Tour Experience
description: Step into the footsteps of legends with the 60-minute Madison Square Garden Tour Experience. Home to iconic teams like the NBA's New York Knicks and NHL's New York Rangers, this legendary venue has hosted unforgettable boxing matches, concerts, and live events. Uncover the secrets that have made The Garden the epicenter of sports and entertainment, gaining access to exclusive backstage areas, luxury suites, and the Chase Bridge for a unique view of the iconic concave ceiling. With something happening year-round, each visit promises surprises and a chance to imagine the roar of the crowd from every angle.

You’ll be able to enjoy the professional choreographic, singing and acting performance with an orchestral accompaniment and bright visual effects.

You will have the opportunity to create your own itinerary with this fully customizable, money and time-saving pass and visit iconic highlights of New York City ranging from the Statue of Liberty, One World Observatory, MoMA, 9/11 museum and memorial and dozens of other NYC highlights. You'll have access to a hop-on, hop-off sightseeing bus trip and will be able to try out a fun range of walking tours or take a multi-hour bike rental.

city_name: Harlem Gospel Tour with Brunch
description: This four-hour tour will give you the chance to experience the gospel culture of Harlem. Starting at the Apollo Theater, you'll explore the 125th Street area and make your way through the Mount Morris Park Historic District. Here, you'll learn about the historical churches and the many well-known musicians who began their careers in this area. The tour will then head through uptown and you'll get to experience the sights and sounds of Harlem on a Sunday, from toe-clapping and foot-stomping to gospel music. You'll also get to participate in sermons and celebrate with world-famous congregational choirs at the various churches. The tour will conclude with brunch at a local dining spot.

city_name: Heart & Soul of Greenwich Village Food & Culture Tour by FNYT
description: 2 INDOOR restaurant tastings are included on this tour! At Foods of New York Tours we are the pioneers of NYC food tours since 1999!Join us on a delicious “multi–ethnic” food tasting and cultural/historical journey through the Heart & Soul of Greenwich Village (The Central Village – the area surrounding Washington Square Park and New York University). Find out why this area of the Village is so popular for its diverse food scene, rich history, culture, counter culture, distinct architecture, and vibrant Greenwich Village nightlife.We will also visit Washington Square Park and learn about its radical protesters, infamous hanging tree, the Washington Square Arch, and walk the same streets that Bob Dylan, Jimi Hendrix, Jerry Seinfeld, Chris Rock, and Amy Schumer did while learning about the music and comedy scene, and why this section of NYC can only be described as The Village!

city_name: Drag Venues & Shows Night Tour in NYC
description: On this tour, you’ll get to experience the glamourous drag culture of New York City up close. You’ll begin by meeting your fellow group members at a lounge bar and then get ready for the tour with your first round of drinks. You’ll gain some insights into the history of drag and the various popular drag venues in the city. You’ll then visit different drag venues to see some of the best drag queens perform dance and drag on stage. You’ll also learn how some of these stages have given the esteemed RuPaul Drag Race some of its best contestants. Finally, you’ll head to Hell's Kitchen, which is one of the most prolific bars in NYC. You’ll get to be right in front of the stage to get a perfect view of the stage. You can round-off the tour with a dance party with the local crowd at Industry Bar.

You’ll get to see three of the park’s most iconic monuments, the largest public ice rink in New York City, the Loeb Boathouse, and more.  As you sit back and enjoy the views, you’ll get to hear fascinating facts and anecdotes about the sights you pass too.

city_name: City Climb: The Ultimate Skyscraping Adventure at Edge
description: Experience the ultimate adrenaline rush in NYC. City Climb is the world's highest building ascent. As a climber, you'll have the thrilling opportunity to scale the exterior of a skyscraper, standing over 1200 feet above the ground. Then, muster your courage and lean out to gaze down from the highest outdoor platform in New York City. This isn't just another adventure - it's a once-in-a-lifetime experience, a record-breaking feat that will stay etched in your memory forever. Dare to take on the City Climb - the pinnacle of urban adventures unlike any other in the world!After your City Climb adventure, enjoy Edge, the highest outdoor observation deck in the western hemisphere. Our unique vantage point on the western side of Manhattan lets you take in the entire skyline from one place. See all the way from the tip of Central Park down to the Statue of Liberty and beyond.

city_name: Statue of Liberty & NYC Skyline Sightseeing Cruise
description: On this 90-minute cruise, you will get on board a 1920s-style yacht and catch glimpse of famous New York City attractions. You will cruise along the Hudson River and pass by Lower Manhattan and Ellis Island and sail into the New York Harbour where you will have an up and close view of the Statue of Liberty. You will also get a chance to admire the majestic New York City skyline.

city_name: Self-Guided Audio Tour of Iconic Central Park
description: This experience allows you to discover the history and highlights of iconic Central Park through a downloadable audio guide for your mobile device. After downloading the app, you'll take a self-guided walking tour to explore the massive park. Over the 90-minute tour, you'll visit some of the park's most famous attractions, including Pulitzer Fountain, Gapstow Bridge, Central Park Zoo and Strawberry Fields. While visiting attractions, you'll hear stories of the park's landmarks and the history of the park itself. While the tour takes 90 minutes to complete, you can explore the park at your own pace by pausing the tour and restarting it when you're ready.

city_name: Speakeasy Drinks & Prohibition Era Nightlife Tour
description: On this evening tour, you’ll get the opportunity to take a walk around New York with a guide and learn about life in the city during the Prohibition era. As you follow your guide through Times Square, Broadway and other iconic sites, you’ll be able to gain insights into the history of immigration in America and listen to stories of New York in the 1920s and 1930s. You’ll have the chance to visit at least three bars, pubs and speakeasies and taste local drinks. Besides, your guide will take you to a rooftop lounge overlooking Manhattan.

city_name: Central Park Self-guided Walking Tour
description: On this GPS-guided tour, you'll take a detailed tour of Central Park using an offline mobile app filled with facts and photos. Your first stop will be the park's famous zoo, home to snow monkeys, penguins, sea lions and more. Other highlights include Bethesda Terrace, the Strawberry Fields memorial to John Lennon and the Alice in Wonderland sculpture. You'll also make a stop at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, which houses over 5,000 years of art from around the world.

city_name: Central Park Cycling Tour
description: On this active tour, you’ll explore the highlights of Central Park by bike, led by a knowledgeable guide. Over two hours, you’ll cover around ten kilometres, discovering landmarks like the Bethesda Fountain and Terrace, Strawberry Fields, Belvedere Castle, the Literary Walk, Cherry Hill and the reservoir. Along the way, you’ll pass celebrity homes and iconic movie locations. You’ll make several stops to take photos and walk around, and your guide will share captivating stories and facts about the historic green space.

Your guide will also tell you captivating stories about the most notorious gangsters and bootleggers of the Roaring 20s.

city_name: Statue of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial Tour
description: On this tour, you'll discover some of New York's most important landmarks. You'll begin with a walking tour through Battery Park, accompanied by a local guide. Leaving the park, you'll travel by ferry to the Statue of Liberty. On Liberty Island, you'll have time to get up close to the statue and walk around the grounds.  The ferry will continue on to Ellis Island before returning you to Battery Park. The final destination of your trip will be the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, where you'll have skip-the-line access.

city_name: Brooklyn, Bronx and Queens Tour
description: On this tour, you'll explore the main attractions of Brooklyn, Bronx and Queens onboard a coach. From the meeting point, the vehicle will take you to Astoria Park in Queens, which offers a stunning view of Manhattan. Afterwards, you'll get a glimpse of the wealthy residences in the Upper East Side and stop by Yankee Stadium, located in the Bronx. Next on the itinerary will be Arthur Avenue, touted as the Little Italy of the Bronx. Here, you'll have time for a coffee break and rest stop. You'll then proceed to the Brooklyn Bridge and end the tour with a visit to the historic landmark of the Grand Central Terminal.

city_name: Brooklyn Heights & DUMBO Self-guided Walking Tour
description: On this self-guided tour, you’ll wander around two of the popular neighbourhoods in Brooklyn – DUMBO and Brooklyn Heights. During the tour, you’ll see both artsy areas and historic sites such as Truman Capote’s house and the Brooklyn Bridge. In DUMBO, you’ll walk cobblestone streets to see converted warehouses as the backdrops for boutiques, trendy cafés and high-end restaurants. You’ll see St Ann’s Warehouse, Jane’s Carousel and views of the Manhattan skyline.  In the Brooklyn Heights neighbourhood, you’ll find local bars, elegant brownstones and the walkways of Brooklyn Bridge Park. Other highlights will include the Fruit Streets, Hotel St George and Cadman Plaza, which houses the Brooklyn War Memorial.

city_name: Philadelphia and Amish Country Day Trip
description: This excursion will allow you to explore Philadelphia and Lancaster County with round-trip transportation from New York City. You’ll visit the historical centre of Philadelphia, where you’ll see the famous Liberty Bell, the Constitution Square and Congress Hall. You’ll also head to Philadelphia's Financial District, Benjamin Franklin Parkway and more. At Amish Country, you’ll ride an authentic Amish horse-drawn buggy through scenic farms. Here, you'll learn about how the traditional community lives without running water, electricity or appliances. You can round off your tour with a visit to the marketplace, where you can check out local products and handmade crafts.

With our large selection of tours and attractions, you'll delve into the heart and soul of NYC, soaking up its rich history, culture, and breathtaking sights. city_name: Ground Zero Tour and One World Observatory Ticket
description: During this fully narrated guided tour, you will visit several September 11th landmarks. First, you will start your tour across the street from the Oculus and the World Trade Center Transportation Hub, the world’s most expensive train station. Next, you will see the 9/11 Memorial Plaza, reflecting pools, the Survivor Tree and museum, the Winter Garden Atrium and Eleven Tears, a memorial dedicated to 11 American Express employees who lost their lives on 9/11.  The tour will culminate with skip-the-line access to One World Observatory where you will ride the Skypod Elevators and step on the circular glass disc Sky Portal. Along the way, your guide will show you large 27.9 cm x 43 cm photos and share stories about Fire Captain Jay Jonas and Ladder Company 6.

You'll get access to some of the city's most iconic landmarks like the Empire State Building, the Statue of Liberty and the Rockefeller Center.  You'll also be able to do a one-day hop-on-hop-off bus tour, take a cruise on New York Harbor and visit many of the city's best museums, including Madame Tussauds, MoMA and the Met.

city_name: Wall Street and Financial District Tour
description: On this two-hour tour, you’ll gain an in-depth look at the workings of Wall Street, the financial capital of the world. You’ll stroll through the Financial District, visiting landmarks like Federal Hall, the Fearless Girl and Charging Bull statues, Trinity Church and the National Museum of the American Indian, home to the United States bankruptcy courts. Assisted by large, printed photos, your guide will teach you about the financial markets, including stories of the 2008 collapse, the GameStop stock event, Bernie Madoff’s Ponzi scheme, how crypto works and how New York Stock Exchange became the world’s largest exchange.  If you’ve selected the tour with the Statue of Liberty option, you’ll end your tour with a ferry trip to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island which you’ll explore on your own, assisted by an audio guide.

city_name: Central Park Pedicab Private Tour

You will get a chance to see numerous landmarks, celebrity apartments and movie locations while taking a tour of the park with a guide. You will see the second-oldest carousel in New York City, the ice skating rink featured in Home Alone 2, Central Park Zoo, and Central Park’s oldest fountain. You will also be able to admire views of New York’s finest apartments, experience astonishing views of Manhattan’s Upper West Side, stop for photos beside the oldest bridge in Central Park and see the Dakota Building. city_name: New York Mafia and Local Food Tasting Walking Tour
description: During this 3.5-hour guided walking tour, you'll be able to stroll through Little Italy, stop at several eateries and hear stories from your guide – a retired New York Police Department detective and lifelong resident of Little Italy. This tour will include exploring Little Italy and the Lower East Side and seeing where mobsters hung out. The tour will begin in the East Village, where you'll see Prohibition-era buildings. Then, you'll eat Italian food like eggplant parmigiana or spaghetti, meatballs and garlic bread at a red sauce restaurant. During the meal, you'll be able to listen to the mafia-related history of the neighbourhood and hear stories about the city’s crime families. You'll also stop to sample fresh handmade mozzarellas and dried cured sausage. The tour will culminate with eating a cannoli near Chinatown’s Canal Street.

city_name: Guided Central Park Bike Tour 2 Hours
description: Explore the tranquil shady paths, charming lakes, and serene lanes of Central Park in New York City by renting a bike. With the freedom to ride at your own pace and explore wherever you please, you'll be able to experience all the highlights of this vast park on two wheels. Whether you're seeking recommendations on the best sights to visit within the park or prefer to ride along city streets to nearby museums and Times Square, an independent bike rental in Central Park will offer you the perfect itinerary that matches your preferences. Which worldwide institution started out as a group of men trading beneath a sycamore tree? Where did Alexander Hamilton drill his unit in preparation for the Civil War? Which Founding Father used to moonlight as an Agony Aunt? Find out all this and more in our deep dive through Lower Manhattan and the remains of New Amsterdam.Fancy a drink along the way? city_name: Evening Sightseeing Cruise on a Wooden Ship
description: On this evening cruise, you’ll have the chance to admire Manhattan’s skyline from aboard a 20-metre-long wooden ship. During the cruise, you will be able to choose from a selection of drinks including soft drinks, beer, wine and champagne. Departing from Chelsea Piers, you’ll set sail down the Hudson River on your way to Battery Park, which is located on southern tip of Manhattan. From there, you'll head out into New York Harbor and pass by Ellis Island, which was the immigration gateway to the United States in the early 20th century. Afterwards, you'll sail by Liberty Island, home to the iconic Statue of Liberty.

city_name: Mafia History in Little Italy, New York City Walking Tour
description: Take a thrilling journey though mob history on this walking tour in New York's Little Italy, where some of the most notorious events in American gangster lore took place.Start with the violent tactics of early black hand gangs and the battles to control the liquor trade during prohibition, leading to the rise of Joe The Boss Masseria.Learn how Lucky Luciano revolutionized organized crime with The Commission of Five Families and his unlikely deal with the government during World War Two.See the infamous Ravenite Social Club and follow the rise and fall of Dapper Don John Gotti.Meet Lieutenant Petrosino, an early crime fighter, and Frank Serpico, who risked his life to expose police corruption.End with visits to the spots where mobsters Sally Bugs Briguglio and Crazy Joey Gallo met their bloody demise.Optionally, see locations from The Godfather and continue to Five Points, the notorious neighborhood popularized by the film Gangs of New York.Distance: 1 mile / 1.5 km

city_name: Admission to Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park
description: This ticket will allow you entrance – and unlimited rides – at the biggest indoor theme park in the Western Hemisphere, the Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park in New Jersey. Located inside American Dream, you'll have over 40 attractions and rides to check out and the chance to see Nickelodeon's most famous characters like Dora, Blue and SpongeBob, perform live. Just some of the family-friendly rides to enjoy will include Bikini Bottom Crosstown Express, Skyline Scream, Nickelodeon Slime Streak, SpongeBob's Jellyfish Jam and Jimmy Neutron's Atom Smasher. You'll also be able to use junior rides, including Dora's Sky Railway, Guppy Bubbler, PAW Patrol Adventure Bay, Rugrats Reptar Go-Round and Blaze's Monster Truck Rally. There will also be options for those seeking more thrilling rides, such as Kraang Prime Pandemonium, Sandy's Blasting Bronco, The Shellraiser, The Shredder and Timmy's Half Pipe Havoc.

description: With this experience, you’ll embark on a two-hour guided tour of the 9/11 Memorial and surrounding monuments, followed by a self-guided tour of the museum. The tour will start at St. Peter’s Church and pass a selection of monuments, including St. Paul’s Chapel, the firefighters’ memorial, the Survivor’s Tree and the Winter Garden at the World Financial Center. You will learn more about the tragic 11 September events from your guide, concluding at the 9/11 Memorial, with its cascading water feature.  You’ll then have free time to explore the 9/11 Museum, which features first-person testimonials by many people affected by the events, as well as images and news videos.

city_name: Central Park and Gluten-free Walking Food Tour
description: During this small-group walking tour, you'll explore Central Park’s landmarks and sample gluten-free foods along the way. Your tour will begin with a bagel breakfast served with coffee or tea. Next, you'll walk to Central Park. In the park, you'll visit Belvedere Castle and pass by Turtle Pond, the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre and Shakespeare Garden. Then, you'll walk down The Ramble pedestrian paths to Bow Bridge, Cherry Hill Fountain and Strawberry Fields. You may add ten minutes to your tour to explore The Mall and Literary Walk before continuing to The Loeb Boathouse and the model boat pond. The tour will conclude with a stop at an Upper East Side bakery to eat a gluten-free muffin or scone.

city_name: Philadelphia & Lancaster County Full-day Tour
description: You’ll set off from New York, through New Jersey to the city of brotherly love – Philadelphia. The first stop is the historic area of the city with a visit to the Liberty Bell, an American symbol of freedom, before going to the Independence National Park and Congress Hall. Wander through the oldest continuously inhabited street in America – Elfreth’s Alley, before continuing on to the financial district, Benjamin Franklin Parkway and Historic Philadelphia. See the famous "Rocky Steps" where visitors often mimic Rocky's famous climb. Then you'll head off to Lancaster County – the home of the Amish. An Amish market sets the scene for a lunch break and the tour includes a buggy ride through the countryside. Learn how the Amish live without modern technology, electricity or running water. You’ll then head back to New York, anticipating to arrive in the evening.

city_name: Two-Hour Manhattan Walking Tour
description: On this two-hour, guided walking tour, you’ll explore Midtown Manhattan in New York. You’ll begin the tour at Radio City Music Hall. Next, you’ll visit Rockefeller Center, viewing its ice skating rink and Channel Gardens. Thereafter, you’ll walk past NBC Studios, followed by Saks Fifth Avenue. You’ll also view St. Patrick’s Cathedral and the Fred French building on Fifth Avenue. You’ll the visit the New York Public Library. Here, you can take photos with the outside the library with the two marble lions, Patience and Fortitude and stroll down Library Way. You’ll also view the Chrysler building and the Grand Central Terminal. You can then take s self-guided tour of the 93-storey SUMMIT One Vanderbilt. Rounding off the tour, you’ll visit the Empire State Building. Here, you can enjoy panoramic city views from the 86th floor Observatory.

You’ll also learn about the role that the slave trade played in shaping the early history and economy of New York.

description: On this guided, three-hour food walk, you’ll explore the cuisine of New York’s Lower East Side. You’ll visit six food stops for lunch including stores, ethnic eateries and mom and pop restaurants. You’ll learn more about the neighborhood’s immigrant working class history and ethnic diversity. You’ll also observe the contrast between the alleys and tenement-style buildings and upscale apartments and boutiques. Additionally, you’ll see trendy bars, music venues and restaurants in the area.  You’ll also visit the Jewish neighbourhood at Orchard Street. You can also taste baked ‘potato knish’ and different types of pickles.

description: This two-hour walking tour of Central Park offers you the chance to visit more than 30 famous spots featured in Hollywood films and television shows. On the next few stops, you will visit the Greek and Roman wing containing elegant statues, imperial Roman busts and intact frescoes. From here, you will head to Oceania to see boldly carved Bisj poles from Papua New Guinea. You'll also have the opportunity to visit Washington Square Park and see the apartment building from the 'Friends' sitcom.

You'll also head to the Statue of Liberty Museum, where you’ll be able to view a variety of artefacts and see Lady Liberty's original torch. From here, you'll hop back on a ferry and proceed to Ellis Island, where you can explore the place by yourself with the help of an audio guide.

Your guide will tell you about their personal connection to the events of that day and you'll hear stories of the emergency responders as you discover the National 9/11 Memorial and the site of the towers.  If you wish, you'll also be able to add on a visit to the One World Observatory at the top of One World Trade Center.

After viewing the workings of the factory, you’ll use the equipment to produce your very own, customised New York souvenir.

city_name: NYC Combo Experience
description: This experience will allow you to visit three popular New York City attractions. Lunch will be at Dave & Busters in Times Square and will include an entree, dessert, unlimited non-alcoholic drinks and a USD 5 play card for the arcade. You'll then get to visit 160-year old St. Patrick’s Cathedral, where you'll have the chance to enjoy an audio tour.

The tour will round off with a visit to Sunny & Annie's Deli, a sandwich haven known for giant sandwiches. Along the way, you will hear about the history of the sandwich and area, and explore the street art.

city_name: Evening Harlem Jazz Tour
description: On this 3.5-hour evening tour, you'll get the opportunity to stroll around Harlem, the renowned neighbourhood of New York, where jazz is heard from every street. You'll first walk along 125th Street and Adam Clayton Powell Jr Boulevard. You'll be able to stop at a couple of nightclubs, pubs and restaurants to listen to jazz bands playing live music. You'll have the chance to gain insights into the local culture and feel the atmosphere of Harlem. You'll have the opportunity to discover historic buildings, old churches and other attractions of the neighbourhood. Accompanied by an expert guide, you'll be able to learn about the history of jazz and find out why Harlem is considered the birthplace of the genre.

city_name: Wall Street and Financial District Tour
description: With this self-guided tour, you'll explore New York City's financial district at your own pace. You'll learn about the city's revolutionary history as you stop outside Fraunces Tavern and then discover the crucial role immigration has played in shaping the city.  On Wall Street, you'll see the Charging Bull, see the historic Trinity Church and head to the New York Stock Exchange as you hear tales of the city's seedy underbelly. You'll also be able to spend some time at the 9/11 Memorial and visit nearby St. Paul's Chapel.

city_name: Self-guided City Walking Tour
description: On this self-guided tour, you’ll explore the highlights of New York, delving into the city’s past and present. Led by GPS, you’ll follow a route from lively Columbus Circle to the iconic Empire State Building.  You’ll pass Carnegie Hall, where music legends perform, as well as two of the city’s most luxurious hotels – the Ritz and the Plaza. You’ll see the Pulitzer Fountain before heading down Fifth Avenue, famed for its high-end shopping. Along the way, you’ll listen to fascinating stories about the places on your route, with inside information about Manhattan’s history and the legal duelling of famous families – the Astors and the Vanderbilts. You’ll also spend time in Bryant Park, Broadway and Times Square and see architectural wonders like the Rockefeller Centre, the Chrysler Building and Grand Central Terminal.

You can choose to spend as long as you like at each venue before moving on to the next. After seeing where Peter Parker became Spider-Man and where Superman's 'The Daily Planet' took inspiration from, you'll round off the tour at Marvel's headquarters.

city_name: Metropolitan Museum of Art Guided Tour
description: On this 2-hour guided tour, you’ll get an express, skip-the-line entry into the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. The museum houses a collection of around 2 million art pieces and you’ll see artworks and artefacts from the ancient Egyptian era to the modern art era. You’ll start from the Ducal Palace, then walk by the Medieval Europe Gallery and reach the Studiolo. You’ll get to explore the armoury worn by Henry VIII in the middle ages. Then you’ll head to the American wing, which houses the Chicago Stock Exchange staircase and other art pieces. Other famous art masterpieces you’ll see include Tiffany Autumn landscape, Madame X, Pop culture then and now, Hudson River School, Washington Crossing Delaware, Jan Vermeer, Madonna with Child, Picasso, Seurat, Van Gogh, and much more.

city_name: World Trade Center Complex Tour
description: During this four-hour guided tour of the World Trade Center Complex, you'll learn about the events of September 11, and have skip-the-line access to the 9/11 Memorial Museum.  You'll meet your guide at the Starbucks across the street from Oculus. From here, you'll make your way to the World Trade Center Memorial Plaza, where you'll be able to take in views of One World Trade Center, the Reflecting Pools, and the 9/11 Memorial Museum. You'll then head to the World Financial Center, where you'll learn about Operation Aegis.  Next, you'll visit the reconstructed Winter Gardens and the Eleven Tears Memorial. Your guide will conclude the tour with an explanation of the complex design and its construction. They'll also share the story of the lost gold and silver reserves of Building Four, and they'll tell you about the Survivor Tree. You'll then take a self-guided walk through the 9/11 Memorial Museum.

city_name: Edge Observation Deck Times Square & Hudson Yard Tour
description: Meet your friendly guide at the iconic Rockefeller Center, best known as the location for its dazzling Christmas tree which can be seen from November to New Year. Visit Rockefeller’s Central Plaza, which is home to the city’s beloved ice rink during winter months, and converts into a popular outdoor café in summer. Wander around the center and learn about its rich-history and significance to the city along the way, then stop to admire the Rockefeller fountains, which are decorated with seasonal floral displays.Walk towards Hudson Yards next, one of the largest private real estate developments in the history of the United States. Learn about and explore this up and coming district then visit The Edge, the highest outdoor sky deck in the Western Hemisphere, boasting a one-of-a-kind design. Suspended mid-air to give the feeling of floating in the sky, The Edge’s viewing deck offers 360 degree views of the city that will leave you breathless.

city_name: NYC 9/11 Memorial and Financial District Walking Tour
description: Hear first-hand accounts of September 11, 2001, on this emotional walking tour of Ground Zero and the financial district with a local guide, uncover the stories surrounding 9/11, and get a better understanding of what happened on the day the World Trade Center fell.The tour begins at the Financial district where you’ll meet your guide and learn about the role the building played after the attacks. From here, head to the 9/11 Memorial and gather around the Memorial Pools. Listen to your guide share detailed information about the monument and the design of the pools, as well as the architecture of the new World Trade Center and its symbolic use of materials, light, and reflections.Continue the tour to the Firefighter’s Memorial where you can pay tribute to the victims and those who fought to save them. Next, visit the Eleven Tears Memorial, which is often missed by visitors without a guide. Finally, watch the reconstruction of the site at the Oculus.

city_name: Admission to the Empire State Building at Sunrise
description: During this experience, you'll be able to explore the Empire State Building at sunrise. To begin your tour, you'll enter the building's interactive museum on the second level. While there, you'll get to view exhibits that tell the story of the building's history. You'll also have the chance to see original floor plans and watch classic film highlights of the building. Afterwards, you'll take a lift ride to the 86th floor. From this unique vantage point, you'll be able to see The Statue of Liberty, Central Park and the Brooklyn Bridge at sunrise. You'll also get to visit the 80th floor, which includes artistic exhibits and an area where you can create a customisable New York City itinerary. Additionally, you'll have the opportunity to go to the 102nd floor, where you'll be able to see spectacular views of the city through impressive floor-to-ceiling windows.

city_name: AIANY Climate Change Tour in New York
description: The best way to understand the many facets of climate change in New York City is by traveling along its waterways! The tour will also explore the importance of the environmental justice movement in New York City.

description: A guided tour through a couple of centuries of entertainment, criminal and general history.The criminal and entertainment history of the area between the old Bloomingdale Road (Broadway) and Riverside Drive. Starting at the Cathedral Of Saint John The Devine (the largest gothic structure in the world) tour highlights include Humphrey Bogart's childhood home, the building that inspired the spooky building in the original Ghostbusters, buildings designed by famous New York architects. Former homes of Hollywood legends, legendary writers, legendary composers and even a couple of legendary criminals. See sites that played host to battles during the Revolutionary War, while George Washington escaped north in September 1776.

What was once considered simply the black neighborhood is now a melting pot of different cultures, each with its own characteristics, capable of enhancing the most beautiful places in the area. You will be amazed at the sight of Saint John the Divine, the largest neo-Gothic church in the world. In addition, you can visit the Apollo Theater from the outside, where Michael Jackson's star began to shine, Sylvia's restaurant, famous for its soul cuisine, up to the church where you can attend a gospel mass. city_name: Pedicab Central Park With Laramie Flick
description: Get me cheap the next month while I'm building up my review count. I am one of the only NYC licensed tour guides giving tours of Central Park and perhaps the only person still pedaling their pedicab (no illegal motor here). I have been giving tours of Central Park since 2004 after graduating from a small college outside of London, though I am from California. I pride myself on providing a history/architecture/movie set tour that is both interesting and true. For example, if anybody tells you you're going to see the Friends' Fountain, it's in LA.Minimum of 2 people please.

city_name: Carmen at The Metropolitan Opera House Ticket
description: Dazzling young mezzo-soprano Aigul Akhmetshina leads a powerhouse quartet of stars in the complex and volatile title role, alongside tenor Piotr Beczała as Carmen’s troubled lover Don José, soprano Angel Blue as the loyal Micaëla, and bass-baritone Kyle Ketelsen as the swaggering Escamillo. Daniele Rustioni conducts Bizet’s heart-pounding score. Later in the season, another cast of world-class singers takes over, with mezzo-soprano Clémentine Margaine reprising her captivating portrayal of the title role, tenor Michael Fabiano as Don José, soprano Ailyn Pérez as Micaëla, bass-baritone Ryan Speedo Green as Escamillo, and Diego Matheuz making his company debut on the podium.

city_name: The Hours at The Metropolitan Opera House Ticket
description: World premiere: Kimmel Center for the Performing Arts, Philadelphia, March 2022 (concert version, performed by The Philadelphia Orchestra); Metropolitan Opera House, New York, November 2022 (staged production)A compelling new opera about three women in different times and places, The Hours is based on the Pulitzer Prize–winning novel by Michael Cunningham and the Academy Award–winning film adaptation that followed. Both the book and the film make heavy reference to an earlier novel, Virginia Woolf’s 1925 Mrs. Dalloway, which forms a sort of parallel background narrative, and the opera uses Woolf’s and Cunningham’s magisterial prose as a departure point from which to explore ambiguities and fluidities that cry out for musical expression.
whats_included: ['All taxes and fees included']

city_name: Little Italy Prohibition Pub Crawl
description: In 1920, the United States enforced the 18th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution which banned liquor production, public consumption and the selling of anything alcoholic. This catapulted the criminal world and helped the gangsters monopolize and grow their illegal business of alcohol. It made some of the most vicious gangsters gain fortune and fame. Illegal bars known as speakeasies opened by the tens of thousands all over the country and served bootleg liquor to the thirsty public. When something is illegal it creates an underworld that will stop at nothing. On this tour you will walk in the footsteps of the gangsters and visit some of the watering holes that served illegal liquor during Prohibition. While sipping on your now legal alcoholic beverage you will hear stories of the Mafia and how it infiltrated into society. At the end of the tour you will be a wiseguy about prohibition and the mob. DEPARTURE TIME: 10 A.M.
whats_included: ['Beverages', 'Alcoholic Beverages']

city_name: Queens Corona’s Culinary Essentials Tour
description: Corona is the culinary epicenter of New York’s Latin American community, a place where you can find regional specialties ranging all the way from the Tierra del Fuego up to Mexico’s northern border with the United States. On this tour of Corona’s culinary essentials, we hit the streets on a Saturday, when the griddles and grills in this already lively neighborhood are working overtime and the street vendors come out in full force.Starting at Corona Plaza, we will drop by a family-run Mexican bakery for sweet breakfast pastries. From there, we’ll continue to an out-of-the-way spot where we’ll sit down with neighborhood families to enjoy a hearty Mexican-style brunch of pit-roasted goat.We will continue along Roosevelt Avenue, stopping by street vendors, an Argentinean bakery and make a stop for a “cholado. We’ll end our day at a small bodega. This last stop leaves us at the edge of Jackson Heights and Elmhurst, having tried what makes Queens such a culinary Promised Land.
whats_included: ['Soda/Pop', 'Lunch', 'Snacks', 'Breakfast']

city_name: Private Tour of The Armour-Stiner Octagon House in New York
description: The Armour-Stiner Octagon House was built in 1860 as a summer home. To this day, the Spring months here in The Hudson Valley are the most delightful time of the year. Victorian Springtime at The Octagon House, a one-hour tour, includes both a guided exploration of the lush 19th-century grounds and an unforgettable interior tour of this marvelously preserved Victorian Summer Home. Guests will see and smell a vibrant array of Victorian flowers inside the fully restored Lord and Burnham greenhouse, listen to an orchestra of songbirds in the Foxglove Garden, and step back in time with a stroll around the 360-degree verandah. In the interior portion of the tour, see many examples of how the natural world heavily influenced Victorian life and design.
whats_included: ['All Fees and Taxes']
location: Departure point45 W Clinton Ave, W Clinton Ave 45, Irvington, 10533Please arrive on the property by car or walking and meet at the steps to the veranda at the end of the gravel driveway.

city_name: Harlem and Gospel Tour with Transportation on Sundays
description: We invite you to attend a gospel Mass service on a lovely Sunday in Harlem. We’ll discover historic Harlem from every angle on this one-of-a-kind tour. Your guide will share fascinating anecdotes about this culturally rich Manhattan neighborhood that was home to such great African American figures as Marcus Garvey, Zora Neale Hurston, Duke Ellington, Josephine Baker, W. E. B. Du Bois, Louis Armstrong, Langston Hughes, and Malcolm X. Take this fun bus tour of Harlem to gain a deep understanding of the neighborhood and its magnificent architecture and rich history. We’ll pass by iconic landmarks.We’ll then enter one of the multitudes of churches with lively congregations that are vital to the community. You’ll be welcomed by a choir and submerged in the energy and fervor that emanates from their powerful songs. When all the voices of the gospel choir come together, something beautiful and transcendent happens.We will need to take into consideration 1 hour travel time total.
whats_included: ['4-hour bus tour with a licensed guide. Admission to the gospel mass']

city_name: Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island: Private Half-Day Guided Tour
description: You will begin your tour at Castle Clinton, a former Fort in Battery Park, where you will board the ferry to the famous Liberty Island. Along the way, you will learn about the remarkable history of the Statue of Liberty, as well as its significance to modern America. From here, you will also be able to enjoy a breathtaking view over the Manhattan skylines and harbour. Boarding at Liberty Island, you will hear all about the fascinating history of the Liberty figure, and how this 100th birthday gift to America from France was shipped from Paris to New York, and finally unveiled after 10 years of construction in 1886.At Ellis Island, you will discover the many extraordinary stories of families journeying to New York City since the earliest days of the United States' founding. You will be able to grab a bite to eat on the island, or alternatively, you may purchase some snacks on the ferry back to Manhattan.

description: Come on our History Walking Tour presented by Junket!Most everyone of a certain age can remember where they were and what they were doing on the morning of September 11, 2001. The nation watched in horror as the clear September skies filled with smoke and debris from the Twin Towers. On this tour, you'll visit several important locations that were impacted by the 9/11 attacks, and view memorials dedicated to those who perished and those who responded in compassion and courage.

city_name: Oppenheimer in New York City - Manhattan Project Tour
description: The Manhattan Project tour provides a fascinating insight into the vast scale of the Manhattan Project and the life of Robert Oppenheimer. You will have the opportunity to visit some of the original sites of the project and Oppenheimer's birthplace, gaining a unique perspective on this world-changing event.Join NY See Tours to explore Manhattan's Upper West Side and discover the city's atomic history. During the tour, you will visit the birthplace of Dr. Oppenheimer, known as the Father of the Atomic Bomb, and the sites of the Manhattan Project's origins. The Manhattan Project, which led to the creation of the atomic bomb, began in Lower Manhattan in mid-June 1942 when General Leslie Groves established its first office. Dr. Oppenheimer was appointed the project's scientific director in the same year. Along with his team of brilliant scientists and engineers, he oversaw the construction and testing of the first atomic bomb at Los Alamos.

city_name: SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown Walking Tour in New York City
description: Embark on a captivating journey through the heart of New York City with our “SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown Walking Tour.” This adventure is not just a tour; it’s an opportunity for you to become a part of the city’s living tapestry. As you meander through the cobblestone streets of SoHo, you’ll discover an artistic paradise, a testament to New York’s vibrant culture and history. Step into Little Italy, where each corner offers a taste of authentic Italian heritage and cuisine, transporting you to another world. Chinatown awaits with its bustling markets and vivid street life, offering an immersive experience into a unique cultural enclave. This tour is more than sightseeing; it’s a hero’s journey into the soul of New York City, uncovering its hidden gems and storied past. Perfect for cultural enthusiasts and urban explorers, our expert guides ensure an unforgettable experience. Join us and dive into the diverse beauty of New York’s most iconic neighborhoods.

city_name: NYC: Lower East Side Guided Food Tour
description: Take a morning to uncover the rich layers underpinning the vibrant Lower East Side. You’ll sample everything from classic dishes to the international food that continues to be introduced to the neighborhood and keeps its food scene thriving. Start New York's oldest deli, Katz's for a mouthwatering pastrami sandwich. Pop by a Dominican breakfast counter for traditional breakfast bites and then head to a modest Chinese restaurant for peanut noodles and pork skin dumplings. Make a few more stops to try classic dishes like bagels, pickles, and authentic Jewish deli meats, before finishing on a sweet note at a local bakery for a cinnamon roll, monster cookie or loaded croissant. Along the way, meet with the local shop owners and learn more about the family traditions passed down through generations which make this one of the most in-demand food destinations today.

city_name: Private Walking Tour: Hidden Jewish Origins of Harlem
description: Before Harlem became the epicenter of the African American experience it was a Jewish immigrant neighborhood. The Gershwin Brothers, Rodgers and Hammerstein, Milton Berle, Lane Bryant, Sophie Tucker and many many more got their starts in Jewish Harlem at the dawn of the 20th century.The neighborhood is filled with synagogues, theaters, nickelodeons, department stores built by Jews for Jews that have been turned into churches, movie theaters, music venues, and political gathering sites that played a pivotal role in modern American history from the Great White Way to the Civil Rights movement. Harlem exemplifies the great melting pot of modern America.

You’ll hear stories about this towering structure’s impressive feats of engineering and its battle against the Chrysler Building for the title of “world’s tallest building”.We’ll wrap up our tour exploring lively Union Square and its own collection of historic buildings and from where you can continue your NYC adventure!

city_name: Alexander Hamilton: Warrior and Financier Walking Tour
description: Best Alexander Hamilton tour in the city, from a published historian who has spent a lifetime reading and learning about Hamilton. There's so much more to this great American than the depiction presented by the Broadway show. We'll fill in the rest of the picture for you in a fun and entertaining way. We'll make you laugh with zingers (did you know Aaron Burr's nickname for George Washington was Old Muttonhead?) and scratch your head mulling over oddities (the location of weird relics like Washington's wooden teeth, Gouverneur Morris's peg leg, etc.). But most of all we'll give you food for thought and make you ponder new questions: Was Alexander Hamilton a Hero or a Villain? What if he had survived his duel with Burr? Would he have become President of the United States? And if he did, how would a Hamilton presidency have changed the course of American history?

city_name: Haunted Village Walking Tour in New York City
description: New York City’s beautiful, historic Greenwich Village neighborhood is one of the most haunted areas in America. Your guide has personally conducted extensive research to uncover stories that will not be heard on any other haunted tour of New York. Come explore a church graveyard haunted by the spirit of Peter Stuyvesant, director- general of this colony from 1647-1664. Experience the supernatural stirrings of those killed in the bloodiest riot in New York City history. Step inside one of the oldest and most haunted bars in New York City. Walk in a popular park built over the unmarked graves of thousands of destitute New Yorkers and feel the eerie sensation emanating from a tree known as the Hangman’s Elm. The tour ends at the most haunted house in New York City inhabited by 22 different ghosts and the site of a grisly murder. Find all this and more on this Haunted Tour of Greenwich Village. Come. if you dare!
whats_included: ['Entrance to a haunted graveyard, haunted bar and haunted library']

city_name: Street Art Pilgrimage in Bushwick
description: Bushwick has long enjoyed a reputation as a prime destination for the world’s most illustrious street artists to leave their mark. Residential, commercial, and industrial buildings have all served as large-scale canvases for muralists to engage with the history, sites, and people of one of the most dynamic neighborhoods in Brooklyn. However, residents and visitors don't always have easy access to basic information regarding any given work of art, such as artist biography, artistic motivation, or how the content and graffiti style relate to local architecture and the community's rich past. This carefully curated and independently researched walking tour is designed to provide greater context surrounding key works of contemporary art while introducing guests to local establishments. This 1.5-hour tour offers in-depth information presented in a fun, engaging way. Unlike other tours, we'll be focusing on a small number of murals, allowing us to dissect the symbolism and meaning as a group.
whats_included: ['Informational guide to major street art sites across New York City', 'Informational guide to Bushwick bars, restaurants, shops, and cafes']

city_name: Statue of Liberty Private Tour for Families with Children
description: The Statue of Liberty is a must-see destination for families visiting New York City, therefore we recommend you to have a private guide to avoid being in a big group.Your guide will engage the all family with a lot of anecdotes and will tell you everything you would like to know about it.You should know that The Statue of Liberty enlightening the World was a gift of friendship from the people of France to the United States and is recognized as a universal symbol of freedom and democracy. It was dedicated on October 28, 1886, and designated as a National Monument in 1924. Employees of the National Park Service have been caring for the colossal copper statue since 1933.At the end of the tour, you can break for lunch at your own expense and then continue your visit on your own. city_name: The Bowery Official Historic District Tour
description: Join us on a journey through over four centuries as we walk down NYC’s oldest street! Originally a Native American footpath and Dutch farm road, site of the first free Black homesteads, it witnessed gang wars, the bloody Astor Place Riot, & Lincoln’s famous anti-slavery speech at Cooper Union. It was the working-class main street for sailors, shopgirls, gangs, gays, and waves of immigrant Irish, Italians, Germans, Jews, and Chinese. NYC’s first entertainment district, it has seminal links to tap dance, vaudeville, Yiddish theater, Houdini, Stephen Foster, Irving Berlin, Mae West, modern tattooing, Abstract Expressionism, Beat literature, improvisational jazz and punk rock. Though it declined in the 1900s, when flop houses and dive bars proliferated, it nonetheless became home to affordable jewelry, lighting, and restaurant supply stores, and a live-work home for artists like Marc Rothko, Maya Lin, William Burroughs, Robert Frank, and Debbie Harry.
whats_included: ['Sightseeing Guide']

city_name: Private Lower Manhattan and NYC Origins from Castle Clinton to 911 Memorial
description: When the Dutch first established a colony here, the Lenape Native Americans called the region home. By the end of the Dutch era in what is now New York, it was among the most diverse places on earth. This tour explores the origin stories of the demographics that would come to play dominant roles in what would become New York City, including the indigenous people, the Christians, Jews, Muslims, Irish, Italians, English, Africans, businesses, real estate agents, artists, peddlers, loners, and dreamers.Highlights include a view of New York harbor, monuments to early immigrants who defined the metropolis, Wall Street with Federal Hall and the Stock Exchange, Alexander Hamilton's grave at Trinity Church, and Fraunces Tavern, the oldest building still standing in Manhattan.

city_name: National Geographic Day Tour: The Untold Story of Central Park
description: Central Park is one of NYCs best loved places to visit. A huge swathe of green covering more than 340 hectares, its known as the lungs of New York. But before the construction of Central Park in 1858, a seven-block section along the western fringe of the park was home to Seneca Village, an African American enclave which provided its residents an escape from unhealthy conditions and pervasive racism experienced in Lower Manhattan, as well as an opportunity to become property owners and build a new community.Newspaper reports that favored the creation of the park referred to Seneca Village as a place of shanties and shacks, but archaeological evidence and documentation from the time shows it was an educated, middle-class community. While the majority of the residents were African American, the village also had a substantial population of Irish and German immigrants. This mix of residents made it a unique example of an integrated community, especially for its time, and the Village boasted churches and a school.When the City acquired the land for Central Park through the process of ‘eminent domain,’ the residents of Seneca Village were displaced and forgotten. In the 1990s, historians rediscovered the Village, leading to an ongoing project to uncover the history of this extraordinary place.Visit the former site of Seneca Village with your National Geographic-trained guide who will share the stories of the people who once created a community here and see the site of the archaeological digs in Central Park, uncovering this little-known history.
why_visit: ['Discover the history of Central Park with a National Geographic-trained guide specializing in African American history, on a walking tour focusing on the Seneca Village area', 'Learn about the people that lived within one of New Yorks biggest communities of African Americans', 'Examine the creation of Central Park from the concept and design to the implementation', 'See the site of the archaeological digs in Central Park, uncovering this little-known history']

city_name: National Geographic Day Tour: Tastes and Tales from Brooklyns Little Caribbean
description: Not far from Central Brooklyn’s famous Prospect Park, there’s a neighbourhood where you can feel the pulse of the Caribbean without leaving the city. Today, the area of Flatbush known as ‘Little Caribbean’ is home to the largest community of Caribbean descendants outside the West Indies.In the mid-20th century, Afro-Caribbean immigrants arrived in the U.S. seeking economic opportunities, with New York City being a top destination. Many who arrived from the Caribbean settled in and around Flatbush in Brooklyn, and today the community spirit is strong.Your National Geographic-trained guide, living and working in Little Caribbean, will lead you on a walking tour of the area to visit a variety of community hubs, absorbing the culture, listening to music, and tasting your way around some of the typical treats of the Caribbean.Begin with a visit to a local Grenadian grocery store for fresh coconut water – bring it with you to add a splash of Caribbean rum at your next stop. Next, visit an African record store that has been in business since the 1970s, selling musical treasures from around the globe.Your taste buds will be in for a treat as you savour spicy Jamaican patties and jerk chicken, finishing with treats from a beloved local bakery thats been a neighborhood staple for over half a century. Meet the family who has owned it for three generations and hear their stories - the perfect ending to a day of discoveries in Brooklyns own Caribbean oasis.
why_visit: ['Explore Brooklyn’s “Little Caribbean” and meet with locals who have shaped this immigrant community, home to the largest population with Caribbean ancestry outside the West Indies', 'Your tour will be led by a local who lives and works in Little Caribbean, who will introduce you to local business owners to hear their personal and family stories', 'Visit a local Grenadian grocery store for fresh coconut water, a local purveyor of Caribbean rum and an African record store that has been in business since the 1970s, for a glimpse of how people live and work in this neighborhood', 'Your taste buds will be in for a treat as you savor spicy Jamaican patties and jerk chicken, finishing with treats from a beloved local bakery while hearing stories from the family owners']
whats_included: ['Guided walking tour', 'Food tasting']

city_name: High Line and Chelsea Market 3 Hour Private Tour
description: Fantastic views, fabulous food, and incredible architecture await you on this private tour of Manhattan’s Chelsea neighborhood and Meatpacking District!We’ll start with an overview – literally – of Chelsea high above on New York City’s High Line. Atop this former elevated railway, enjoy views of the Hudson River and hear the story of its redevelopment as a park.From here, our New York City walking tour enters the Chelsea Market, known for its diverse culinary offerings. With everything from artisan cheese to authentic Italian gelato, you might need to ask your guide for their top picks!After our Chelsea Market tour segment, we’ll head to the Meatpacking District, a once-industrial warehouse district turned hip commercial area. Dip in and out of the spacious shops hinting at their former lives as slaughterhouses, or, following your tour, visit the world-renowned Whitney Museum of American Art and take a short walk to one of NYC’s most unusual river attractions, Little Island!
